titles: The Woful lamentation of Jane Shore, a goldsmith's wife in London, sometime King Edward the Fourth's concubine, who for her wanton life came to a miserable end: set forth for the example of all wicked livers. To the tune of, Live with me, &c.
publisher: Printed by and for W.O. for A.M. ...,
notes: Place and date of publication taken from Wing (2nd ed.)
Right half-sheet contains: The second part of J. Shore, wherein her husband bewailed his estate, her wantonness, the wrong of marriage, and the fall of pride.
Reproduction of original in: University of Glasgow. Library.
